place.name: LLANLLAWDDOG
place.gazetteerText: LLANLLAWDDOG, a parish in the district and county of Carmarthen; on a branch of the river Gwili, 6½ miles E by N of Conwil r. station, and 7½ NNE of Carmarthen. It contains the village of Rhydyrgane; and its Post town is Carmarthen. Acres, 7,013. Real property, £2,808. Pop., 696. Houses, 152. The property is subdivided. The living is a vicarage united with the vicarage of Llanpumpsaint, in the diocese of St. David's. Value, £150. Patron, the Vicar of Abergwilly. The church is dedicated to St. Llawddog, and is good. There is a Calvinistic Methodist chapel. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
